skill.name: pdf-processing-pro
skill.description: Production-ready PDF processing with forms, tables, OCR, validation, and batch operations. Use when working with complex PDF workflows in production environments, processing large volumes of PDFs, or requiring robust error handling and validation.
skill.summary: Production-ready PDF processing with forms, tables, OCR, validation, and batch operations. Use when ...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Legitimate PDF processing toolkit using standard Python libraries (pdfplumber, pypdf, pytesseract). All functionality is local file I/O for document processing. The 201 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting markdown code examples as executable code. The skill performs no network operations, reads no environment variables, and executes no unauthorized commands.

content.value_statement: Processing PDF documents manually takes too much time. This toolkit provides production-ready scripts for extracting text, handling forms, extracting tables, and performing OCR on scanned documents with batch processing support.
actual_capabilities: Extract text from PDF documents with formatting preservation
Analyze and fill PDF forms with validation and error handling
Extract tables from PDFs with automatic column detection
Perform OCR on scanned PDFs using Tesseract
Process multiple PDFs in batch with parallel support
Validate PDF integrity and form data before processing
limitations: Does not modify PDF visual content or layout structure
Requires Tesseract installation for OCR features
Does not support encrypted or password-protected PDFs
XFA form formats are not supported by pypdf

use_cases.title: Extract report data
use_cases.description: Pull tables and text from financial reports and research documents for analysis in spreadsheets.

use_cases.title: Process form submissions
use_cases.description: Automatically fill and validate PDF forms from application data or spreadsheet entries.

use_cases.title: Digitize scanned contracts
use_cases.description: Convert scanned PDF contracts and agreements into searchable text documents.

prompt_templates.title: Extract PDF text
prompt_templates.prompt: Use PDF Processing Pro to extract all text from [document.pdf] and save it to [output.txt] with formatting preserved.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze form fields
prompt_templates.prompt: Use PDF Processing Pro to analyze [form.pdf] and output a JSON schema showing all form fields, their types, positions, and whether they are required.

prompt_templates.title: Extract tables
prompt_templates.prompt: Use PDF Processing Pro to extract all tables from [report.pdf] and export them to [data.csv] with proper headers.

prompt_templates.title: Batch process PDFs
prompt_templates.prompt: Use PDF Processing Pro to batch process all PDFs in [invoices/] directory. Extract text from each and save to [processed/] with the same filename but .txt extension.

output_examples.input: Extract all text from monthly_report.pdf and save to output.txt
Analyze form.pdf for all form fields
output: - preferred_contact: radio, required, options: [email, phone, mail]

output_examples.input: Extract tables from quarterly_report.pdf to Excel
output: Exported Table_1 to Excel sheet (Revenue Data)

best_practices: Always validate PDF files before processing to catch errors early and fail fast
Use batch processing for multiple documents to improve efficiency and reduce overhead
Install Tesseract OCR system package before processing scanned documents
Test with sample PDFs first to verify output format meets requirements
anti_patterns: Processing password-protected PDFs without decrypting them first
Ignoring OCR confidence scores when working with scanned documents
Processing very large PDFs over 100MB without streaming or chunking
Skipping form field validation before filling forms with data

faq.question: What PDF formats are supported?
faq.answer: Standard text-based PDFs, forms (AcroForms), and scanned documents via OCR. XFA dynamic forms are not supported.

faq.question: What are the file size limits?
faq.answer: Small and medium PDFs under 50MB process efficiently. For larger files, process page by page or use streaming.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing tools?
faq.answer: Use the Python scripts directly in your codebase. Import pdfplumber or pypdf following documentation examples.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: All processing happens locally on your machine. No data is sent to any external servers or services.

faq.question: OCR is not working. What do I do?
faq.answer: Install Tesseract OCR system package for your platform (macOS: brew install tesseract, Ubuntu: apt-get install tesseract-ocr).

faq.question: How does this compare to online PDF tools?
faq.answer: This tool runs entirely locally with no file size limits or upload restrictions. Data never leaves your machine.
